dt: {bc}to move at or as if at a canter {bc}{sx|lope||}
{bc}to ride a horse at a canter
{bc}to cause to go at a canter

et: short for obsolete {it}canterbury{/it}, noun (canter), from {it}Canterbury{/it}, England; from the supposed gait of pilgrims riding to Canterbury
shortdef: to move at or as if at a canter : lope
to ride a horse at a canter
to cause to go at a canter
